#c 我也曾經聽過拉阿魯阿族的人說他們以前所住的地方叫就Hlacʉna。
#n hlacʉna為啦阿魯哇的發音，即為Kanakanavu的racʉna

#c 在他的頂端有一個地方卡那卡那富稱其為Rangurunga。

#c 他們在那裡結束打獵之後，他們帶著那些狗回到Racʉnga.
#n 孔老師認為原是發音為pui’i

free: #e However, the dog mother bought her doggies back to Rancurunga herself.
#c 但是那隻生小孩的母狗獨自帶牠的小狗回到Rancurunga。

#c 據說那樣來來回回有三次

#c 當時卡族的老人家就想著狗狗那樣來來回回究竟有什麼原因。

free: #e Therefore, elders at that time thought perhaps (those dogs) were telling them that they should move.
#c 因此，當時卡那卡那富老人家就想著或許狗狗是在告訴他們，他們該搬家了。
#n ’e是’esi的縮減
#n araavari 遷移、換位置; aravari-a請換;aravari-o去更換
#n mariivari回答; arivario kari Na’u 回答Na’u的話

free: #e Afterwards, many Kanakanavu males moved Rancurunga with their dogs to live there.
#c 之後，就有不知道幾位卡族男士帶著狗搬到Rancurunga的地方定居。
#n c<um>a-cʉvʉrʉ 指長大，在此指「生活」。

meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e However, they thought without females, they could not have good lives there.
#c 但是又想沒有女人在那裡生活很不方便。

free: #e SO, they returned to nacʉnga to bring their women and children to Rancurunga to live and farm there.
#c 所以，他們回到nacʉnga要帶他們的女人和小孩到Racurunga那裏生活、墾地、種田。
#n 口誤racurunga應該要是nacʉnga

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e Other Kanakanavu saw it looked good to move there.
#c 其他卡族人看到搬到那裡好像蠻好的。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They also did that.
#c 也都那樣。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They also moved to that place.
#c 也都搬去那裡。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They lived in Rangurunga.
#c 就在Rancurunga那個地方。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They farmed that place.
#c 那裡開墾田園。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They built houses.
#c 蓋房子。

meta.language: 卡那卡那富語, Kanakanavu, Kanakanavu
meta.speaker: 孔岳中, Pani Kanpanena, male, 1951

free: #e They had lived there for a long time.
#c 他們在那邊待得很久。

free: #e These are what I’ve heard. I’ve heard that we Kanakanavu once lived in Nacʉnga and then moved to Rancurunga。
#c 這些我所聽到的，據說我們卡族曾經住在Nacʉnga之後搬到 Rancurunga那裡。
